citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A female Maltese (tag#315) was found to have tartar and plaque build-up on all of her teeth. Her upper front teeth
(incisors) were loose to the touch. The kennel caretaker said they did do a surface cleaning after the dog had a physical
exam in fall 2023. Teeth loose to the touch are a sign of more advanced dental disease and need to be seen by the
attending veterinarian for further treatment. Ensure that this dog is seen by the attending veterinarian and the treatment
plan is followed.
***Correct by 3/5/2024
A female Shih-tzu (tag #301) was observed to have some dried and wet discharge by her eyes. Her right eye was hazy on
the surface and the white part had some redness to it. Her left eye had some discharge on the surface and around the
eyelids. I called the AV who said this dog should likely be getting eye ointment. Also, this dog was sensitive to the mouth
and wouldn’t allow dental observation. The one tooth I could see was the right upper canine tooth (bigger front tooth) and
it was plaque covered and loose to the touch. Eye problems and a loose tooth, if untreated can become worse and cause
dog discomfort. Ensure this dog is seen by the AV and follow the prescribed treatment plan.
***Correct by 3/5/2024

A dog (tag#313) was noted to have a disposition in December on APHIS 7005 (Dogs on Hand). The caretaker said it was
donated to a rescue, however APHIS 7006 was not completed. Record of Disposition (APHIS 7006) is required to be
completed and maintain for disposition of animals. Ensure that APHIS 7006 is completed and maintained for all
dispositions.
***Maintain correct from 2/23/2024 forward.

A Male mini poodle (tag#352) was noted to have died in the records. The kennel caretaker said it was newer to the kennel
and had been jumping over enclosure walls and recalled that it was being housed in enclosure #5 but on 12-22-2023 was
found in enclosure #2 with injuries from the bigger dogs housed there. They said they contacted the attending veterinarian
right away but unfortunately it passed away before getting to the clinic. Enclosures need to be maintained in a way that
keeps dogs from getting in with other dogs that aren’t compatible. Ensure enclosure are maintained in a way that contains
dogs securely and prevents them from getting injured.
***Correct from 2/23/2024 forward.

The facility has a written Exercise Program but it has not been approved by the new AV they have visiting the kennel. An
Exercise Program that is approved by the AV helps ensure dogs are provided adequate space and exercise. Ensure that
the AV is involved in the planning for exercise of dogs and that the exercise program is approved by the Attending
Veterinarian.
***Correct by 3/14/2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A female Maltese (tag#315) was found to have tartar and plaque build-up on all of her teeth. Her upper front teeth 
(incisors) were loose to the touch. The kennel caretaker said they did do a surface cleaning after the dog had a physical 
exam in fall 2023. Teeth loose to the touch are a sign of more advanced  dental disease and need to be seen by the 
attending veterinarian  for further treatment. Ensure that this dog is seen by the attending veterinarian  and the treatment 
plan is followed.  
***Correct by 3/5/2024 
 
A female Shih-tzu (tag #301) was observed  to have some dried and wet discharge by her eyes. Her right eye was hazy on 
the surface and the white part had some redness to it. Her left eye had some discharge on the surface and around the 
eyelids. I called the AV who said this dog should likely be getting eye ointment. Also, this dog was sensitive to the mouth 
and wouldn’t allow dental observation. The one tooth I could see was the right upper canine tooth (bigger front tooth) and 
it was plaque covered and loose to the touch. Eye problems and a loose tooth, if untreated can become worse and cause 
dog discomfort. Ensure this dog is seen by the AV and follow the prescribed treatment plan.  
***Correct by 3/5/2024 
2.75(a)(2) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
A dog (tag#313) was noted to have a disposition in December on APHIS 7005 (Dogs on Hand). The caretaker said it was 
donated to a rescue, however  APHIS 7006 was not completed. Record of Disposition (APHIS 7006) is required to be 
completed and maintain for disposition of animals. Ensure that APHIS 7006 is completed and maintained for all 
dispositions.  
***Maintain correct from 2/23/2024 forward. 
3.6(a)(2)(iii)  Critical
   
Primary enclosures. 
A Male mini poodle (tag#352) was noted to have died in the records. The kennel caretaker said it was newer to the kennel 
and had been jumping over enclosure walls and recalled that it was being housed in enclosure #5 but on 12-22-2023  was 
found in enclosure #2 with injuries from the bigger dogs housed there. They said they contacted the attending veterinarian

right away but unfortunately it passed away before getting to the clinic. Enclosures need to be maintained in a way that 
keeps dogs from getting in with other dogs that aren’t compatible. Ensure enclosure are maintained in a way that contains 
dogs securely and prevents them from getting injured. 
***Correct from 2/23/2024 forward. 
3.8 
   
Exercise for dogs. 
The facility has a written Exercise Program but it has not been approved  by the new AV they have visiting the kennel. An 
Exercise Program that is approved  by the AV helps ensure dogs are provided adequate space and exercise. Ensure that 
the AV is involved  in the planning for exercise of dogs and that the exercise program is approved  by the Attending 
Veterinarian.  
***Correct by 3/14/2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
